workflow.name: Inventory reconciliation between Notion & Airtable with GPT-4o Slack alerts
workflow.description:
## üìò Description
 This workflow performs automated inventory reconciliation between Notion (physical counts) and Airtable (system counts), ensuring both databases stay synchronized.
 It fetches records from both systems, merges them into a unified comparison payload, validates the structure, and calculates discrepancies.
 If a mismatch is detected, the workflow automatically updates Airtable with the corrected count and notifies the operations team on Slack.
 If everything matches, a simple ‚ÄúNo action needed‚Äù Slack message is sent.
 Any malformed or incomplete payloads are logged into Google Sheets for audit tracking.

## ‚öôÔ∏è What This Workflow Does (Step-by-Step)

üü¢ Manual Trigger ‚Äì Execute Workflow
 Starts the reconciliation process on demand.

üì• Fetch Records from Notion
 Retrieves physical stock data (cycle count) stored in Notion.

üì¶ Fetch Records from Airtable
 Loads inventory data from Airtable‚Äôs system-of-record table.

üîÄ Merge Notion + Airtable Inputs
 Combines both datasets into a single payload for unified processing.

üîç Validate Payload Structure (IF Node)
 Ensures that key fields (like id) exist.
 Valid ‚Üí continue
 Invalid ‚Üí logged to Google Sheets.

üßæ Log Invalid Versioning Requests to Google Sheets
 Stores broken or incomplete payload entries for later review.

üßÆ Build Combined Notion + Airtable Payload (Code Node)
 Constructs the structured comparison object:
{ notion: {...}, airtable: [...] }

üìä Compare Notion Record With Airtable Record (Code Node)
 Performs core reconciliation logic:
Matches items by name
Compares physical vs. system count
Calculates difference
Determines if a correction is needed
If mismatch ‚Üí flagged for update.

üîé Check If Record Requires Update (IF Node)
 Branches logic into:
Mismatch ‚Üí Update Airtable + Alert
Match ‚Üí No action summary

üõ†Ô∏è Update Airtable Record With Corrected Count
 Writes the accurate physical count from Notion into Airtable.

üß† Configure GPT-4o ‚Äì Slack Summary Models
 Two models:
For ‚Äúno action needed‚Äù summaries
For ‚ÄúAirtable updated‚Äù discrepancy alerts

ü§ñ Generate Slack Summary / Generate Slack Summary1
 AI produces short, precise, operations-friendly Slack messages based on whether a discrepancy existed.

üí¨ Slack ‚Äì Send Summary Notification / Send Update Notification
 Sends final Slack message to the operations user, confirming:
Stock match status
Updates made
Item details
Difference values

## üß© Prerequisites
- Notion API integration
- Airtable API credentials
- Azure OpenAI GPT-4o
- Slack API connection
- Google Sheets OAuth

## üí° Key Benefits
 ‚úî Eliminates manual reconciliation errors
 ‚úî Keeps Airtable continuously aligned with real physical counts
 ‚úî Provides instant Slack visibility to operations teams
 ‚úî Logs all invalid or malformed cases
 ‚úî Centralizes Notion + Airtable consistency checks

## üë• Perfect For
-  Operations teams managing multi-system inventory
-  Warehouse cycle count workflows
-  Audit-driven companies needing accurate stock data
-  Businesses using Notion + Airtable as parallel systems

workflow.name: Notion & Airtable Stock Sync Validator with AI Slack Notifications

Compare Notion Record With Airtable Record

parameters.text:
=Using the cycle count comparison result below, generate a concise Slack message for the operations team.

Data:
{{ JSON.stringify($json, null, 2) }}

Requirements:
- If needsUpdate is false ‚Üí send a friendly ‚ÄúNo action needed‚Äù message.
- If needsUpdate is true ‚Üí highlight mismatches clearly.
- Keep message short, clean, and easy for a Slack channel.

Output only the final Slack-ready message.

options.systemMessage:
=You are an AI assistant that generates short, clear Slack notifications for the operations team about inventory cycle counts.

Your job:
- Read the comparison result coming from Notion vs Airtable.
- Explain whether the stock levels match or if there is a discrepancy.
- If there is a difference, clearly state:
  ‚Ä¢ Item name  
  ‚Ä¢ Notion count  
  ‚Ä¢ Airtable count  
  ‚Ä¢ Difference  
  ‚Ä¢ Required action  

- If everything matches, send a simple ‚Äúall good‚Äù message.
- Keep the tone simple, concise, and professional.
- Output only the final Slack message (no explanations, no extra text).

nodes.name: Slack ‚Äì Send Summary Notification
nodes.notes: Sends formatted notification to #product-faqs channel with FAQ summary, category, and links

nodes.name: Update Airtable Record With Corrected Count

parameters.text:
=Using the cycle count comparison result below, generate a concise Slack message informing the operations team that a stock discrepancy was found and Airtable has been updated.

Data:
{{ JSON.stringify($json, null, 2) }}

Instructions:
- Highlight the item name.
- Show the physical (Notion) count and old Airtable count.
- Show the difference.
- State clearly that Airtable has been updated to match the physical count.
- Keep the message short and team-friendly.

options.systemMessage:
=You are an AI assistant that writes short, clear Slack notifications for the operations team regarding inventory cycle count updates.

Your job:
- Report mismatches between Notion physical counts and Airtable system counts.
- Clearly show item name, counted quantity, system quantity, and difference.
- Confirm that Airtable has been updated with the corrected count.
- Keep the message concise, professional, and easy to read.

Do NOT add unnecessary text or emojis unless helpful for clarity.

nodes.name: Slack ‚Äì Send Update Notification
nodes.notes: Sends formatted notification to #product-faqs channel with FAQ summary, category, and links

parameters.content:
## üîÑ Notion & Airtable Stock Sync Validator with AI Slack Notifications

This workflow compares item-wise inventory counts between Notion (physical count) and 
Airtable (system count) to ensure accurate stock reconciliation. Once triggered manually, 
the workflow fetches one Notion record and multiple Airtable records, merges both datasets, 
and performs a one-to-one comparison. If both systems match, a Slack summary confirms 
‚ÄúNo action needed‚Äù. If differences exist, the workflow updates Airtable with the correct 
quantity and sends a discrepancy alert to the operations team. All invalid or malformed 
payloads are logged into Google Sheets for review.

### üîπ Workflow Overview
1. Manual trigger ‚Üí Fetch Notion & Airtable records  
2. Merge both datasets into a unified payload  
3. Validate payload structure (id, item fields)  
4. Compare counts and detect discrepancies  
5. If mismatch ‚Üí update Airtable with correct quantity  
6. Based on result ‚Üí generate Slack summary (Updated / No Action Needed)  
7. Send Slack notification to operations  
8. Log invalid requests into Google Sheets  

### üîπ Tools & Integrations
‚Ä¢ Notion ‚Üí Physical inventory count  
‚Ä¢ Airtable ‚Üí System inventory record  
‚Ä¢ GPT-4o ‚Üí Slack message generation  
‚Ä¢ Google Sheets ‚Üí Invalid log  
‚Ä¢ Slack ‚Üí Ops alerts

## Data Intake & Merge ‚Äî Notion + Airtable
Fetches physical count from Notion and system count from Airtable.
Merges both datasets into a single comparison-ready payload.
Invalid or incomplete structures are logged to Google Sheets.

## Reconciliation Logic ‚Äî Count Comparison
Compares physical stock from Notion with system stock from Airtable.
Detects mismatches, calculates the difference, and determines if a record requires correction.
If counts match ‚Üí workflow branches to ‚ÄúNo Action Needed‚Äù.
If mismatch ‚Üí marks item for system update.

## System Update ‚Äî Fixing Airtable Record
When discrepancies are detected, updates the Airtable record with the corrected physical count.
Ensures the system-of-record stays accurate for reporting and inventory control.

## Notification Engine ‚Äî AI Slack Messaging
Uses GPT-4o to generate short, clear Slack messages for inventory reconciliation.
If no update needed ‚Üí sends a ‚Äúcounts match‚Äù summary.  
If Airtable updated ‚Üí sends a discrepancy alert summarizing Notion count, Airtable count, and difference.
All notifications go to the operations user for real-time visibility.

user.name: Rahul Joshi
user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
